trans-unit.source: You may be sharing a Connection among multiple threads because you have experienced poor concurrency using separate transactions.

seg-source.mrk: You may be sharing a Connection among multiple threads because you have experienced poor concurrency using separate transactions.

target.mrk: You may be sharing a Connection among multiple threads because you have experienced poor concurrency using separate transactions.

trans-unit.source: Here are some tips for increasing concurrency:

seg-source.mrk: Here are some tips for increasing concurrency:

target.mrk: Here are some tips for increasing concurrency:

trans-unit.source: Avoid queries that cannot use indexes; they require locking of all the rows in the table (if only very briefly) and might block an update.

seg-source.mrk: Avoid queries that cannot use indexes; they require locking of all the rows in the table (if only very briefly) and might block an update.

target.mrk: Avoid queries that cannot use indexes; they require locking of all the rows in the table (if only very briefly) and might block an update.

trans-unit.source: In addition, some programmers might share a statement among multiple threads to avoid the overhead of each thread's having its own. Using the single statement cache, threads can share the same statement from different connections. For more information, see "Using the statement cache" in .

seg-source.mrk: In addition, some programmers might share a statement among multiple threads to avoid the overhead of each thread's having its own.
Using the single statement cache, threads can share the same statement from different connections.
For more information, see "Using the statement cache" in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/cittuning"></ph>.

target.mrk: In addition, some programmers might share a statement among multiple threads to avoid the overhead of each thread's having its own.
Using the single statement cache, threads can share the same statement from different connections.
For more information, see "Using the statement cache" in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/cittuning"></ph>.
